description: The version isn't useable for me. I can connect a gmail account, but I can't do the same for MS outlook one. You need to add some sort of auto-recognision like in Thunderbird. The point is outlook doesn't use IMAP (or use but in Thunderbird it is a paid addon), so in Thunderbird I used to use a kind of different connection way provided by MS. It was called office365 or something. Some improvements to UI also are desirable. The way messages are shown (at least by default) is inconvenient. I like the concept of soring today, yesterday, ..., but I don't like to open every category manually. Please make messages list displayed vertically - this will help looking for e-mails. Also I have noticed no graphics are loaded from e-mails - this should be fixed. The idea of auto-detecting a scam e-mail looks interesting but improvements are needed. It's really weird to see for example a gmail letter marked as a scaming one and have a proposal to delete it immediately. If possible, make the application consume less RAM please. I don't think 800 MB is OK. I hope this review will help to improve the application. I want to use kde apps for better integration with plasma DE. Big thanks to the devs for the efforts!

STOP PUTTING BLOAT EVERY WHERE KDE MORE LIKE KILLDE

THIS SUCKS

you need to get rid of broken apps like these, this is just bad, ditched Windows for bloatware turns KDE is even worse than Windows in this, atleast Windows bloatware works, this sh1t doesnt even work even if for some psychopatic you wanted to use it
Pretty much crashes on every operation. Could be an issue with Plasma 6, but I've tried Kmail on and off over the years and it has never worked correctly.
can't connect to IMAP
Love Kmail, the integration with Plasma is good. I can use the contact stored on my NextCloud instance.
After last upgrade it will no longer connect to the SMTP serve with SSL of the server is using a self cert. Which made K mail useless
It worked fine on Kubuntu 16.04. But now I am using Kubuntu 18.04. It doesn't send any mail(.
Plenty of features and well integrated with KDE. It is particularly handful to handle many accounts.

I have 9 IMAP accounts and the app is rly unstable. Load very slow and not always show me my emails on every INBOX. Most of time, i need to click few times on the INBOX folder to show my current emails
multiple inboxes have to be dealt with filters

Came back to KDE after a few years away on Gnome. Loaded up my fave email client....and it just doesn't work. Accepts all the settings, verifies IMAP and SMTP servers, auto-configures ports. Then. Does. Nothing. Nada. Zilch. Just sits there like a politician during recess.
We need to figure out a secure manner of connecting to GMail accounts, especially managed accounts with secondary logins, such as schools. Like the program, but that is a major thorn in my side.

I can't believe KDE puts out this email app. It does not work with Gmail. Thunderbird has worked with Gmail for years. How can you not get this right? Also, I cannot post a review if I have 1 star selected. Really?
The application is no longer trusted by Google for Gmail using 2FA
It is amazing how few decent email clients exist on Linux
summary: Terrible. Crashed every time I tried to add account

description: I'm using KMail and address book only. For email I like the app because it's got a great interface, its threading of conversations makes sense, and preferences are highly configurable. I see a lot of older reviews complaining about stability, but I'm not having any issues with IMAP since installing in early January 2020. Best email app I've tried for Ubuntu and I've been through quite a few!
summary: Great app, highly configurable, excellent interface

description: Like the title says, 'it doesn't work at all' on Fedora 31, Gnome 3.34.3 . I'd high expectations but I'm really disappointed in KMail.
Feels faster than thunderbird and evolution
needs attention
summary: Does not open on Ubuntu Mate

description:
Guys, I know you all are using Gmail.
In this rating, I will explain how to use Gmail. Let's think that we have all the dependencies installed. If you don't, then install them (see KDE website for assistance) or reinstall the application, it will download everything.
 
 Okay, let's count that this is a fresh install.
1st step: Open KMail
 If you are using the Discover store, click "Launch" in the up right corner

2nd step: Dismiss the setup screen, click "Settings", then "Configure KMail..."

3rd step: Setup your identity
 Tip: Setup an HTML signature with right aligning, inline text, and something like "Regards, John Doe"

4th step: Click "OK" and then go to "Receiving" tab

5th step: Click "Add" and choose "Custom Account..."

6th step: Click "IMAP E-Mail Server"

7th step: Configure IMAP
7.1: Choose a title for the account
7.2: Select "imap.gmail.com" as the IMAP server
7.3: Write your gmail ID as the username
  example: john.doe@gmail.com
7.4: Write your gmail password as the password
  example: john.1999
7.5: Choose whether or not you want to download e-mail for offline use 

8th step: Click on the "Advanced" tab

9th step: Change "Authentication" from "Clear text" to "PLAIN"

10th step: Click "OK"

11th step: Wait at least 7 seconds

12th step: Select "Sending"

13th step: Click "Add..."

14th step: Configure outbox
14.1: Choose SMTP
14.2: Choose a name for the server
14.3: Click "Create and Configure"
14.3.1: Write "smtp.gmail.com" as the "Outgoing mail server"
14.3.2: Click "Server requires authentication" and then click "Store SMTP password"
14.3.3: Write your gmail ID as the "Login"
14.3.4 Write yout gmail password as the "Password"
14.3.5: Go to the "Advanced" tab
14.3.6: Choose "SSL/TLS" as Encryption
14.3.7: Choose port 465
14.3.8: Change "Authentication" from "LOGIN" to "PLAIN"
14.3.9: Click "OK"
14.4: Click "OK"

Done! Restart the app, so it will function better.

Kmail is the best choice for the Plasma desktop as it allows the best integration.
Not perfect though. There is the occassional glitch. Sometimes the unified inbox will loose tally with emails. If you click on an email read in another client and Kmail has not updated it may then stick requiring a re-start.
You cannot print email with images. Only the text will print.

Very feature-rich mail client. I had been using Thunderbird for quite a while, but found KMail more convenient. Also, it works with Exchange servers (that's what I'm using it for), but initial setup of Exchange is quite a pain here: first, you have to find where to add an Exchang account, and then you face a bug that is well-known for years - password for your Exchange is not saved automatically, you have to save it manually in Kwallet. But as you win this initial setup you'll get a solid perfect mail client.
Cannot connect to office 365 account with IMAP. It just does not work. Thunderbird get connected without problems.

I tried to use KMail on KDE Neon but it did not work at all. After moving to Kubuntu 20.04 and a hard battle I managed to set my Gmail account up. Then I wanted to add several other email addresses that I use. Turns out KMail subscribes to and downloads all folders except for the inbox one, making it pretty useless. Googling showed me the bug first showed up in 2011 and in 2020 people are still affected. Hard to believe that such a fantastic DE has such a poor email client. I went back to Evolution which works perfectly despite not having a fancy shell. I hope one day KMail catches up with the rest of KDE.
There are mysterious menu trees, the email view is not intuitive, and the whole application has feel of late 90's - remember Visual Studio Basic..
Useless apps. does not work..

KDE KMail is a fully functional email client! It works great! (if only I could get a @kde.org email...) It's better than Mozilla Thunderbird! (exept for the fact that it can't send Email conversations when connected to Gmail.)

I started using Kmail in the search for more Plasma integration and it provides just that. It shouldn't be judged on first glance, use it and learn all it's features on the fly.

I had a couple of small issues but they were quickly resolved by the KDE team. Now it's my main stream email client.
It would have been nice to fix breaking issues within... two years... of discovery, but after all this time KMail appears to be abandoned and is currently not fit for anything at all.

It's funky and doens't work quite like you would expect an email client to work. 
Sure, it's got lots of things to fiddle with, but even the most basic thing such as replying to an email and having your reply top requires messing with a template. 		
The reqview app in KDE won't let me submit a one star rating, so I give it two. This rating app needs a rating. Geez. It's no wonder Linux won't ever take over the desktop.
summary: typical Linux attempt at functional software

description: I guess this app doesn't work.
I really like using Kmail from within Kontact (I don't know why kontact isn't on Discover) because it does exactly what I want and integrates flawlessly with Plasma.
summary: Another great part of KDE PIM

description: I messed with this app for 45 minutes and never got a single email account set up. It's far too complicated to use. I can set up Thunderbird in 5 minutes but nothing I did worked in KMail. Uninstalling. It's not worth the effort.
kmail on Fedora is not working at all. It is a scam

After several hours im unable to make it work with google accounts. A shame bc i do not want to use thunderbid but its the only real alternative along mailspring (i do not like its mandatory ID account)
Like others, I spent forever trying to get this to work. Never got it working ... It's useless. What is all this other stuff that other email apps don't ever require you to enter?
a non-intuitive POS.
Just flickers and can't do much.
better than thunderbolt, thank you

I now use this daily with my gmail accounts and its nicely integrated with KDE. 

I notice some other reviewers struggled to get it working with gmail. I enabled 2-step verification, then created an app password (Google account->security->app password). It's been my default mail since and even allows me to digital sign my messages.

Has a few minor UI bugs.
I don't want or need kwallet, so I set up kMail with the password, but for some reasion kMail keeps asking for the password. i'm looking at other program.

Have not yet read a full email, it keeps closing when I try to read the emails.
No the first account I clicked for unified inboxes but that did work and the emails where in the account inbox.
On the plus side it pick up all my local folders but not the accounts
summary: Have not yet read a full email

description:
I can't really say very much about this email app. I would like to try to set up Protonmail, but it requires that I put in the ports and othter configurations.

I believe it was meant to be made as simple as possilble, but a work around is needed.
does the job, fits well within Plasma Desktop. I had zero crashes so far, and it looks as good as the QT theme you use
i think you should try this
summary: naa i do know ,what is is blaa

description: It is sleek, fast, and easy to use. ProtonMail can be used. You simply have to specify "protonmail.com" instead of "pm.me". This allows the Mozilla provider search to function. After that you can modify ~/.config/mailtransports and ~/.config/emailidentities to your liking.
It start up as garbled garbage graphics, it is probably not C, java or some other such thing. It does not work on Fedora 34.
Perfectly works on Fedora 34
i hate this app
When it started it said it was going to import setting, but that failed and I see no place to manualy add accounts.
summary: Not so state of the art

description: Better than I thought. Setup is simple and I get everything I need. Current Kmail is much better and seems to have its previous jankiness smoothed over. Not the greatest but definitely worth a try.
First offers to import things from Thunderbird, then it tells that this is impossible and then at last it crashes. Bummer!
Installed it, first time opening it, UI completely messed up, nothings in place after just resizing the window once. Uninstalled it immediately.

looks nice, downloads with gmail, but is so full of bugs that it becomes useless:
- adblock makes all message disapear
- emails are not sent
- using all krganiser & kontact doubles some accounts.

going back to evolution.
KMail is nice, but it needs to be revamped. The UI obviously looks dated. Other than the dated UI, there's no problem.

Devs took away the ability to remove the eye sore of and HTML bar right in the middle of the application. Once the user is able to modify the application per their use case as every other linux user perfers, I will change my rating.

I have a specific paid-for email service - (Runbox) sadly this client can't configure folders properly from it using IMAP
Uninstalled

Can't get gmail to work. Several different errors to work with. This one "Failed to get D-Bus interface of mailfilteragent" and this one "Failed to transport message. The remote host closed the connection". There was another one also I can't find to log. Both mailspring and thunderbird work fine. I guess I'm going back to one of those.

I wanted to migrate setting from Thunderbird only to get the following error message:
"Could not start the import wizard. Please make sure you have the ImportWizard properly installed."
Looks like yet anothe Linux program by geeks for geeks ...

This email client is so frustrating. It's been nearly 2 years, and they still haven't resolved the issue with connecting to Gmail via IMAP. I'm sure ProtonMail using the bridge would be a complete nightmare. Additionally, I do not understand the whole 'Local Folders' nonsense. It is a poor quality app.
Need more simplicity and good ui
Tried again with yet another glitch: akonadi_migration-agent "in progress" but nothing happens despite leaving iut to run for hours! Needless to say removed once again & will NEVER try it again.

The best email client I have ever used, regardless Windows or Linux world.

You can do everything with it. Get rid of stupid aggregations or define your own ones. The icons in a toolbar do not change with your every move (which is one of the most stupid things ever invented by human kind, by the way) You put the icons wherever you want and they stay in the exact place you chose. 

The only one more thing should be put into the app options is the ability to get rid of dead black, the vertical message html indicator bar. You can change the color of the bar for less noticeable but the bar must stay, developers decided so and everyone has to f**k off.

If somebody doesn't know - when you open html message with anything exept plain text you advertise your IP to the world because the additions have to be downloaded from their sources to your IP address. 
But - Dear developers - I use commercial VPN and really don't care about my IP. Please, ask Google a question : "How to get rid of stupid html indicator in linux kMail?" and you will see I'm not the one having the opinion.

Apart from the above a-must-have-html-bar, the kMail is really one of the best apps in Linux timespace.
My truly and best regards to the guys who made it.
summary: Try it and you'll love it

description:
I used to love Kmail. Until it started rendering things in so many broken ways. The header gets changed based on the css styling of the email itself (WHAT??!?), the header fields get squished together overlapping each other (WHAT?!?!?), the email content is white text on white background, making it literally unreadable.

Seriously. Why are you adding plugins for a mail client that can't even view mail itself correctly? Fix the baseline issues first that have been present for years!
summary: Still broken in too many ways

description: It mostly works, but emails don't appear until you click "view HTML message", and the UI looks like something from 2005.
It works perfectly with GMail. I seem to have an issue with it working for Outlook.

Okay, this is a great mail client but the layout for kde but the layout is terrible. E-mails are like letters or articles so it needs more vertical space than horizontal space. Please make it so that the mail-reading area has full vertical space and other parts are in other space
its great (as long as you dont need to shoot out your both legs by using exchange)
This app has gone stagnant and no longer works with most providers. Don't even try it for Exchange (O365). It's basically a glorified Gmail client now.
This is not a "state of the art" app for emails, but feels as if it is stuck in the late 90s. It works, but there are a lot of better email apps -- even Gmail.
Lots of bugs, ugly, unusable. Very sad. Thunderbird works much better

thunderbird worked out of box, kmail seemed to find the right settings but then made several accounts for my one email, not a single one of which actually worked. I'm guessing that kmail does, actually, function, but the setup experience makes it unusable.
summary: made several accounts per address and never got mail

description: KDE DE is great to look at, but has so much dysfunctional invasive bloat. I don't want your ugly broken mail app, or the ugly password lock, or the organizer, or any of the other preinstalled KDE bloat. Can't uninstall any part of this bloat without breaking KDE.
Installation klappt hervorragend, nur leider funktionieirt nur der Mailabruf und nicht der Versand. Ebenso ist es nicht möglich eien Mail weiter zuleiten. Kubuntu noble numbat mit KDE Desktop.

Ich finde das Kmail ein sehr gutes Programm ist, allerdings hab ich zur Zeit Schwierigkeiten, eine stabile Verbindung zum Imapserver von Outlook zu bekommen. Mal funktioniert es einen Tag lang, dann erklärt er mir wieder das der Server das PW nicht lesen kann. , komischwrweise funktioniert es unter Xfce, poder auch unter KDe mit Thunderbird hervorragend. Ich arbeite mit. 15.6

etwas umständlich einzurichten, wenn es aber erst einmal steht, dann sehr viele Konfigurationsmöglichkeiten und umfassende Funktionen. Ein Programm, welches ich sehr gerne nutzen möchte. Aber es stürzt bei vielen Aktionen regelmäßg ab, funktioniert in machen Bereichen nicht. Für mich auf Tuxedo-OS nicht zu gebrauchen. Alternative: Das schlankere Claws-Mail.
mann wird nicht eingeführt, einzustellen eher was für die experten, für den 0815 nutzer weit zu kompliziert. rate eher zu thunderbird
Einfach und nicht mit "Müll" vollgestopft wie Thunderbird.

Ist leider nicht von Bugs verschont und hat vielleicht auch nicht das intuitivste User-Interface. Dafür ist das einer der wenigen E-Mail-Clients, die ich nach meinem Geschmack konfigurieren kann. Sehr schön! Vielen Dank!
Habe mir KMail unter KDE Neon installiert aber bekomme nur ein kapputes Fenster

KMail ist flexibeler als Thunderbird, stabiler als Outlook und in etwa genauso intuitiv wie Apple Mail. Ich gebe zu, für meine 3x Mailadressen und alle Konfigurationen, rund um Layout und Ordnerverhalten, ca. 2 Stunden Zeit benötigt zu haben. Aber es lohnt sich! Wer dieses Mailprogramm nicht auf seinen Bedürfnisse eingestellt bekommt, dann weiß ich auch nicht weiter... Super ist auch die Integration mit Korganizer.
Kann alles, tut alles, wer es zu kompliziert findet ist eh bei GNOME besser aufgehoben als bei KDE-Anwendungen. Unter Wayland leider noch Murks ...
Many features, but unclear, cumbersome and ugly.

Wann mistet KDE diesen Schrott endlich aus?!
Die Standard-Einstellungen sind eine Katastrophe. 
Die Einrichtung eines neuen E-Mail-Kontos ein Abenteuer. Kompliziert, komplizierter, Kmail!
Der letzte Schrott einstern ist zuviel
Window update do not work properly on F34.
es werden hier unnötige packete mit installiert die sich nicht entfernen lassen.
summary: es werden unnötige pakete mit installiert

description:
Stimmt, ich kapiers nicht. Die Benutzerführen ist katastrophal.
So gehts leider nicht, es ist wohl nur für Profis.
Schade

Wenn hier jemand schreibt das er mit Thunderbird klar kommt aber nicht mit KMail dann stimmt mit der Person etwas nicht. Es ist sogar nich einacher einzurichten und ist sehr performant. Egal ich mag KMail ^^. Einfach nur Konto hinzufügen PoP3 und SMPT hinzufügen die für jeden Anbieter im Netz stehen. Die die damit nicht klar kommen sollten sich lieber mit Windows auseinandersetzen als mit Linux ^^. Schönen Abend noch an alle!
summary: Ich weiß nicht was Manche haben ^^

description: Ich würde mal drigend an der Konfiguration arbeiten

Funkionen sind sehr flexibel einstellbar und insofern super. 
Nur könnte das Konfigurationskonzept ein wenig mehr UX Expertise gebrauchen (am besten mit Nutzer*innen Feedback im Prozess).

Was definitiv für den produktiven Einsatz im professionellen Kontext fehlt, sind geräteübergreifende Schlagworte per IMAP. Schlagworte, die nur auf einem Gerät existieren, sind in diesem Kontext unbrauchbar. Bevor das nicht gelöst ist, kann ich das auch nicht zur allgemeinen Verwendung vorschlagen. Dazu gibt es auch bereits seit langem ein Feature Request, das zudem eine der höchsten Bewertungen bekommen hat.

Für den privaten Einsatz empfehle ich das unbedingt, sofern man Wert auf Flexibilität und Konfigurierbarkeit geht (aber das gilt ja für die gesamte KDE Welt).
summary: nur 1 Feature Request von professioneller Nutzbarkeit entfernt

description: Ich habe es schon früher verwendet, da es Einstellungsmöglichkeiten bot, die andere E-Mail-Clients nicht an Bord hatten, aber leider zum Teil nicht gut liefen. Die Bugs sind inzwischen behoben. Wer von Thunderbird kommt, muss sich etwas in der Handhabung umgewöhnen. Die vorhandenen E-Mail-Adressen werden inzwischen problemlos von der Mozilla-Datenbank abgerufen und die Gmail-Abrufe sind besser, als jene von Thunderbird, der derzeit die Konten doppelt darstellt. Die Oberfläche ist noch ein zu wenig kompliziert, so ist z.B. die Einrichtung eines neues E-Mail-Kontos nur schwer zu finden, dann aber leicht zu handhaben. Danke!
zwe Stunden und unzähligen ladevorgange läst sich immernoch die Installation nicht beenden und nichts neues inallire

Alles läuft wie bei Outlook in einen Ordner. Trennung der Konten war für mich nicht ersichtlich. Mag bei der Erst-Installation am Häkchen an der falschen Stelle gelegen haben.. Das ist aber auch durch komplette De-Installation und Neu-Installation nicht behebbar. Der Dienst für den Mail-Dispatcher verbrauch fast die gesamte Prozessorleistung und RAM. Sehr schade, da viele interessante Möglichkeiten zur Konfiguration. So leider doch weiter mit altem TB V. 68.12.1 mit Enigmail oder Seamonkey.
Enlazada al navegador solicita claves no controladas por el usuario en la nube.
He intentado configurarlo y no puedo, ni con el asistente, ni de forma manual, sigo usando el Thunderbird.
Integrada al entorno de plasma, pero muy compleja la configuración, aunque es una buena opción
No entiendo los problemas que da el asistente para crear una cuenta nueva automáticamente. Para introducir todo manualmente y tener errores constantes, ya me vuelvo a 1998.
esto no funciona ny patras, un ttal desastre en esta version, nose ven lo recibidos en Imap, no hace caso a la configuracion, una merde total

La idea está bien.
La integración con KDE es buena.
Funciona a medias.
Simplemente dejó de sincronizarse.
Necesitan hacer el cambio que hicieron con krusader --> dolphin

La interfas es más propia de ppio. de los 2000 que de los años 20 del s. XXI. Los filtros para etiquetar automáticamente no funcionan casi nunca. Borrar memsajes de la bandeja unificada, tampoco, o a veces los borra pero luego vuelven a aparecer. La sinclonización con servidores IMAP falla cada dos por tres (comprobado con 5 servidores diferentes). La búsqueda de mensajes parece programada por un beodo y da resultadops absurdos cuando los da... 

En fin, una pena, porque la mayor parte del trabajo está hecha y solo tendrían que pulir estos detalles así como modernizar un poco la interfaz y sería una herramienta fantástica.
He conseguido que la bandeja de entrada cargue los mensajes pero no envía ninguno, ni con asistente ni nada. Decepcionante.
Facile d'utilisation, fonctionnel et complet. Je crois que j'ai tout dit.

Kmail est un logiciel de messagerie électronique qui m'est fort utile avec un compte Outlook ! Très complet (voire trop ?), il propose des fonctionnalités que peu d'autres clients mail possèdent, du code de fond de mail jusqu'à la configuration HTML de la signature numérique ! Néanmoins, il ne fonctionne toujours pas avec un compte Google (un peu comme toutes les apps KDE....hélas), en raison de "La fonctionnalité "Se connecter avec Google" qui a été désactivée temporairement pour cette application"......
Appel aux développeurs ! On a besoin de vous ! Ce foutu Google vous considère comme pas fiables ! Faites leur regretter leur dénigrement de l'Open Source !
summary: Il manque le support de Google Mail !

description: Il semble qu'il manque une clé de validité des ordres donnés par l'utilisateur. L'application marche d'une manière fantaisiste dans presque toutes ses fonctionnalités; même pour l'envoi du courriels.
summary: Thunderbord réputé autrement plus stable que Kmail

description: Impossible de lancer l'assistant de comptes. Veuillez vérifier que AccountWizard est correctement installé.

serait intéressante si elle fonctionnait , réception courriel parfait
mais envoie nul le carnet d'adresse ne fonctionne pas et dans l'aide pas de français ; je supprime tout
summary: appli nulle impossible d'importer carnet adresses

description: impossible de supprimer l'application que faire ?

vivement QT6, il ne sera peut-être plus possible de faire pire dams Kmail. Ayez pitié de ceux qui doivent l'utiliser au quotidien. Malgré une bonne configuration des comptes en ligne, il faut en plus se répéter dans Kmail....qui ne se connecte à gmail que lorsque cela lui plait....
Первым ж делом не просто не смогла настроить на майл ру, но еще и ушла не попрощавшись.
summary: Запутанный интерфейс, много лишнего и потому толком не работает

description: Нормальное приложение ,не хуже чем Thunderbird или MailSprings ,легко настраивается на любой сервис , авторам +
Высвечивалась ошибка постоянно
Работает, но соглашусь с предыдущим оратором, все как то сложно, запутано, неудобно. Впрочем как почти все в KDE.
В приложение нельзя войти, исползуя Google, так как оно еще не прошло нашу проверку.
summary: Вход в аккаунт Google временно заблокирован для этого приложения

description: Так и не нашли общего языка с Gmail.
Так і не зміг налаштувати через постійні вимагання якогось паролю в менджері паролів. Не працює. На жаль
вылетает сразу после установки, с учетными записями почты маил ру не дружит.
Хорошая заащита .
Федора 34, не работает, не добавляет почтовые ящики. Удаляю!!
Замечательное придожение. Лёгкое в настройкею Быстрое и удобное.

До этого не пользовался никакими почтовыми клиентами. KMail показался очень неудобным, по сравнению с Thunderbird (который я решил попробовать после использования KMail).

Минусы KMail, с которыми я столкнулся:
- долгая загрузка писем (~1к писем в минуту)
- неудобный интерфейс (зачем нужна верхняя панель? кнопки файл (что? какой файл?), правка, настройки - можно было уместить в другое место, и вообще сделать иконками!)
- у меня не отрисовывался html в письмах (вообще огонь)

Установил Thunderbird - никаких из указанных недостатков у него нет.
summary: Не понравился. Ушёл в другой клиент

description: Отличное приложение, настроил и забыл, наслаждаюсь почтой!
Работать можно, однако это больше мучение, нежели работа. Это действительно печалит — хотелось бы что-нибудь родное для кед
Gmail перестал отсылать письма ((((, заколебали со своей политикой безопасности, хоть отказывайся уже...
Невозможно добавить ни одну учётную запись.

In KDE 6 stpped working at all. The old famous bug seems to return, but even restarting akonadi does nothing. Agree with many here... We would like ti have integrated out of the box application for DE instead of serching any other client like Thunderbird for example. Very disappointed.
